hanoi.title: Hanoi
hanoi.gettingThere: Fly to Noi Bai International Airport (HAN) — major hub with direct flights from most Asian cities and many international routes.

essentials.gettingAround: Grab for rides. Walking in Old Quarter. Motorbike rental 150,000-200,000 VND/day.
trainConnections: Ho Chi Minh City (Reunification Express, 30-34 hr)

ho-chi-minh-city.title: Ho Chi Minh City
ho-chi-minh-city.gettingThere: Fly to Tan Son Nhat International Airport (SGN) — Vietnam's busiest airport with extensive international connections.

essentials.gettingAround: Grab is king. Motorbike rental 150,000-200,000 VND/day. Metro Line 1 now operational.

da-nang.title: Da Nang
da-nang.gettingThere: Fly to Da Nang International Airport (DAD) — 3 km from city center, with domestic and international flights.

essentials.gettingAround: Grab for city. Motorbike rental 120,000-150,000 VND/day. Easy day trips to Hoi An (30 min).

hoi-an.title: Hoi An
hoi-an.gettingThere: Fly to Da Nang (DAD), then 30-minute drive or shuttle to Hoi An. Regular buses and taxis available.

essentials.gettingAround: Bicycle rental 30,000 VND/day (the best way). Walking in Ancient Town. Motorbike for day trips.
essentials.language: Vietnamese, English widely spoken in town

hue.title: Hue
hue.gettingThere: Fly to Phu Bai International Airport (HUI) or train from Da Nang (2.5 hours on the scenic Hai Van Pass route).

essentials.gettingAround: Bicycle or motorbike rental. Grab available. Boat trips on Perfume River.

ha-long-bay.title: Ha Long Bay
ha-long-bay.gettingThere: 4-hour drive from Hanoi, or 2-hour drive to Cat Ba Island. Most visitors book overnight junk boat cruises from Hanoi.

essentials.gettingAround: Tour boats are the main transport. Kayaks provided on cruises. Cat Ba Island has motorbike rental.
essentials.airport: Van Don International (VDO) or Noi Bai (HAN) + transfer

sapa.title: Sapa
sapa.gettingThere: Overnight train from Hanoi to Lao Cai (8 hours), then 1-hour drive to Sapa. Or direct bus from Hanoi (5-6 hours).

essentials.gettingAround: Walking and trekking with local guides. Motorbike rental available. Cable car to Fansipan.
essentials.airport: Noi Bai (HAN) + overnight train or bus

nha-trang.title: Nha Trang
nha-trang.gettingThere: Fly to Cam Ranh International Airport (CXR), 30 km from Nha Trang center. Domestic flights from Hanoi and HCMC.

essentials.gettingAround: Grab for city. Motorbike rental 120,000-150,000 VND/day. Boat tours for islands.
essentials.language: Vietnamese, Russian (large Russian tourist community), English

phu-quoc.title: Phu Quoc
phu-quoc.gettingThere: Fly to Phu Quoc International Airport (PQC) — direct flights from Hanoi, HCMC, and some international routes.

essentials.gettingAround: Motorbike rental 150,000-200,000 VND/day (essential). Grab limited. Boat tours for islands.

dalat.title: Dalat
dalat.gettingThere: Fly to Lien Khuong Airport (DLI) or bus from Ho Chi Minh City (6-7 hours through scenic highlands).

essentials.gettingAround: Motorbike rental 120,000-150,000 VND/day. Grab available. Walking in town center.

travelTips.visaFree: Citizens of 13 countries get 45-day visa-free entry. E-visa available for all nationalities (90 days, $25).
travelTips.bestOverallMonths: October to April (dry season varies by region). Peak: December-March.
travelTips.rainySeasons: North: May-September. Central: September-December. South: May-November.
travelTips.simCard: Viettel, Mobifone, or Vinaphone SIM at any airport. 100,000-200,000 VND for 30 days with data.
travelTips.grab: Grab works in Hanoi, HCMC, Da Nang, Nha Trang, and most major cities.
